headline: Easy, Eggless Strawberry Ice Cream
description: This eggless strawberry ice cream is made with simple ingredients for a delightfully creamy strawberry dessert. A snap to make in an ice cream maker.
name: Easy, Eggless Strawberry Ice Cream

recipeInstructions.text: Combine strawberries, milk, cream, sugar, vanilla, salt, and food coloring in a large bowl.
Pour strawberry mixture into the freezer bowl of an ice cream maker; freeze according to the manufacturer's directions.
Transfer to an airtight container and freeze until firm.

review.reviewBody: I followed Naples34102 lead by using 2 cups cream and one cup half and half. The ice cream turned out so well. I had purchased local strawberries which weren’t as lovely looking as they once were, for a deep discount price and used those. Oh my. Absolutely scrumptious. Will make again using other fruits.

I made this today( 7-19-22) and followed the recipe as is and it turned out delicious. Real easy-to-follow. I may use more sugar or and a smidge of light corn syrup, but otherwise I will be making this quite often.
I loved it! We puréed the strawberries since my 3 year old is squimish about “things” in her food. It turned out fabulous and she loved it!
Followed the recipe exactly. It was a little sweeter than we prefer. I put freshed sliced strawberries over the top and that made it perfect. Thanks for sharing the recipe.
This recipe came out perfectly as written! It was a huge success and did not last long at all!
Made half the recipe...perfect for my Icecream maker

Tasty! I substituted Stevia In the Raw for the sugar in exact amounts and doubled the recipe. I also used frozen strawberries. I microwaved the strawberries for 1.5 minutes and crushed them in the blender. 

The ice cream was great. I might chop half the strawberries and use the blender for half next time.

Delicious! I didn't make any intentional changes. :) I had extra strawberries (run through my Ninja, so it ended up being a little over two cups). It was SOOO good! 

I thought later it might be fun to experiment with adding a hint of balsamic vinegar. We'll see. Next time, because this will DEFINITELY be made again!
I can't keep my family out of this! Everyone is hovering over the tub with spoons! I made exactly as written.

Excellent, added half a cup melted white chocolate chips in the mixture and half a cup unmelted when the ice cream was almost ready.

It came out awesome. Good texture and flavor. Super easy & hassle-free. Definitely making it again Thank you.
Great as is. Was also great with half a mashed banana added.

Loved this recipe. There was no need whatsoever to change this ice cream as listed in recipe. Love it’s texture. I’m so thrilled to have an ice cream maker now - I’ll never go back to store bought ice cream. Thanks! Cheers***

Love, love, love this recipe! Made this for my husband yesterday and he could not tell that it was an eggless ice cream! I scaled the recipe to 6 servings as my 3 pint bowl machine was the only one frozen and ready to go. Super easy to combine ingredients. I did use frozen strawberries and defrosted them before chopping/mashing. Worked great! I also added two drops of red food coloring to give it a more pink color base. Plan on making more this weekend! Great summertime treat to beat the heat.
Easy to make and great flavor. Make it many times a year
It turned out great. Consistency and flavor. I did use a ninja to blend the strawberries as I had nothing to mash them with.......otherwise.....great strawberry ice cream!
Just added extra strawberries and was delicious

I made this last night in my cuisinart ice cream maker. It was delicious. I cut the recipe in half and it fit my machine perfect. I used 1 1/2 cups 2 percent evaporated milk and 1/2 cup regular 2 % milk. Also I used a mix of Splenda and white sugar. Yum!

I've made this recipe several times now, and its a perfectly good starter recipe, but it's not without its flaws. Personally speaking, I like my ice cream smooth and creamy, and with fruit-based ice cream products, especially where the fruit itself is somewhat fibrous in nature (e.g. strawberry, cantaloupe, etc.), that's simply not going to happen, unless the fruit is first pre-cooked and poured through a sieve. Pureeing it in a food processor, and add it directly into the ice cream machine cannister, hoping that it will turn out smooth and creamy, is a fool's errand.
Delicious!!! Better than BR, Edys, T&J,...

I made this yesterday. I have stomach issues with lactose. I can handle some but not a lot. I changed this to: 3 cups Lactose Free Whole Milk and 1 cup Heavy Cream. I also reduced the mashed strawberries to 1 cup and absolutely no food coloring. It's not necessary. I try to use all natural ingredients in my cooking as much as I can. It was absolutely perfect!
Nice

Raving comments from diner guests . Best strawberry ice cream ever. Reminded me of gelato I had in Italy years ago. Used only 1 cup of milk so it would not overflow my ice cream maker. Next time will use only 3/4 cup of sugar, I do not like things very sweet.

This didn’t turn out for me due to volume - it yields too much for my ice cream maker and after an hour of churning, it was still not freezing so I gave up and stashed it in the freezer. Hoping it freezes in there and the consistency is OK.
Used the recipe just as it is—delicious. Will make it again.

Very good. I used peaches instead of strawberries but otherwise followed it as written. Smooth, with just the right sweetness. 
We prefer cooked egg custard type but this is very good and very quick.
After reading the reviews, I also cut to 6 servings for my kitchen aid. I let the strawberries sit with the sugar and added some lemon juice too. Made cream
It was very good! The only thing is that the strawberries were very cold and you could have prevented that by putting the strawberries in after. I really liked it though!
This came out great! I used 2% milk because it's what I had on hand. I also steeped a vanilla bean in the milk. I'll definitely make this again.
My bf told me this was the best and closest ice cream to a store bought one that I made so far !
So great and so easy! Will definitely make it again!!

My go to recipe! I love the fact that there are no eggs & no cooking. I add 3T of vodka to keep it from getting too hard. I’ve also found a recipe for roasted strawberries. It’s great because it removes a lot of the water from the berries. Because you add sugar to the strawberries I would use less sugar in the ice cream. I add them at the end of the freezing process.

Wonderful flavor. I made this vegan with cashew cream and coconut cream (blended everything together then added minced strawberries) and it was delicious! I can't wait to try it with other seasonal fruit...

I made this ice cream only this time I used a jar of Toschi Black Cherries in syrup and only added 1/4 cup of sugar since the jar of cherries is so sweet! Before the entire mixture was ready to come out of my electric ice cream maker I added 1/4 cup of the remaining cherries. This was delish!
Tasted wonderful and fresh. I used a cup of half n half instead of milk and cut back on the sugar and used 1 1-2 teaspoons of vanilla. Wonderful treat.
We made it with sweetened condensed cream instead of whole midland omitted the 2 c sugar and just soaked the strawberries in bout 1 c sugar and purées them it was so good light and creamy
This was the best home made ice cream we have ever made. we didn't need the food coloring to get a nice color using fresh florida strawberries. This will be a staple on our camping trips from now on.
might use fewer strawberries next time

I used raw milk from our family’s dairy farm and puréed fresh strawberries from a local berry farm. 
Because other reviews mentioned overflowing their machine, I halved the recipe, but definitely did not need to with my KitchenAid mixer. 
Since it was so hot and humid outside, this recipe never did become solid ice cream texture. But, it was the best soft-serve strawberry ice cream we have ever had!
I will try again on a cooler day to see if the consistency will thicken.
I made it and it was delicious . It wasn’t to much for my ice cream maker!!
For home made ice cream, this was really very good. Not quite like store bought, but nice and smooth and totally delicious.
Went by the recipe given but added extra cup of half & half to fill container to amount needed. It’s delicious!

Very tasty, but family agrees that there were too many strawberry bits (they freeze very hard). I pulsed the berries in a food processor. I also mixed some of the cream and all the sugar in a pan on the stove, and heated it until I was sure the sugar was dissolved. Other than that, I stuck to the recipe. Because I had made strawberry juice for jelly that day, my husband suggested I use the juice instead of the berries. Maybe will try that next time.
So easy and quick!! Was absolutely delicious-will make it from now on and experiment with different flavors??
Made this with my daughter from some fresh strawberries we picked. It's the best recipe so far.

This was yummy! My daughter has an egg allergy so I thought I’d give this a try and I really liked it. I’ve had other eggless ice creams that left a bad aftertaste in my mouth, but this one doesn’t. Delicious!
Excellent, easy to make and taste great!
This was great! I loved it, only change is whole milk for half and half, which makes it smooth
my kids and I love it. We make it weekly.
So good!
I usually prefer to make custard base ice creams however this recipe is actually really good!
Delicious, easy and not expensive! Family loved it! We will make this again!
I made it for company this weekend, I tasted and was delicious. Company has not yet tried. I did not use the food coloring, no need. Easy to make and will make again
We think it needs more strawberry flavor and more sugar.
My family loved this recipe & ask for it every summer!
I used the heavy cream, whole milk, strawberries, and 1/2C sugar and it tastes great! It fit in my Kitchen Aid ice cream maker attachment.

I haven’t made this, but I was curious if anyone had substituted frozen strawberries instead of fresh and how that would turn out? I have a large strawberry patch and been storing up quite a bit of strawberries.
Easy to make and really good... I recommend it
Made this with 1% milk, because I was too lazy to go to the store, and it was absolutely delicious. FANTASTIC recipe that I will use on a regular basis.

After reading the reviews, I made changes. I used a can of sweetened condensed milk + sugar to taste. I pureed the strawberries. I added a package of unsweetened strawberry Kool aid for extra flavor. Next time I will omit the salt.

Priceless! I bought an ice cream maker at an estate sale for $12 and made the best strawberry ice cream ever. I cut my strawberries, covered them in a cup of sugar for several hours and puréed them in the blender. It was out of this world good.

I made it exact to recipe. Because it didn't reach the fill line on my ice cream maker, I added another pint of heavy whipping cream, one cup berries and half cup of sugar. Excellent taste, and very creamy. I topped it with homemade strawberry jam. My company loved it, and so did I.

AWESOME!!!! Omg delicious!!! And SUPER easy! Used my Cuisinart ice cream maker. It made a lot of ice cream, but was not in danger of overflowing. The only thing I did differently was added roughly chopped golden Oreos during the churning process and afterward crumbled them on top and added finely sliced frozen strawberries as well for a little garnish. My family LOVED it!!

I used three cups of half and half, one cup of organic whole milk, pureed strawberries to get the 1/1/2 cups, and then finely chopped 1/2 cup strawberries. Poured it in the cuisinart ice cream maker and started the machine. It over-flowed slightly. Taste was delicious and firmed up nicely in the freezer.

Really easy recipe. Just like other reviewers I think cutting the vanilla extract and adding strawberry extract would be yummy. I didn't have any strawberry extract, but I can certainly see how it would have been better that way. (I added a dash of cardamom for fun).

I made this strawberry ice cream exactly as it was written. It was so delicious! My husband loves it too. Rich, creamy, yummy. My ice cream maker was only half full when it was ready. Next time, I'll double the recipe. Thank you!

I made this with the modifications suggested by naples review. It was definitely a creamy, rich ice cream. A little heavier than I was wanting, but still delicious! I will use this recipe again as it was originally written, for a lighter taste. Very simple to put together as well!
I loved it. Reduced the sugar a bit. Perfect for me. But kids would probably appreciate full sugar and another 1/2 cup of strawberries. Will make it again for sure.

The recipe quantitis are right on. The strawberries however were to hard when frozen fresh. Even on a very small dice still very hard. I would try, ( like someone else wrote) to puree the berries some. Or even cook the strawberries with the sugar and drain off some liquid. We all know cooked strawberries produce liquor. When I try it again will re-post

This is the best homemade ice cream I have made. And it was quick and easy. I was trying to use up some cream and half and half, which equaled 2 cups of each. Then I used frozen raspberries instead of strawberries. The only problem was that it overflowed in my ice cream maker. We ate it anyway.
The best ice cream I've ever eaten!
I never liked strawberry ice cream until I had this. I can't believe how much different and better the flavor is!
This ice cream was definitely easy to make. Not my favorite of the ice creams I've made so far. Not sure that I'll make it again.

Very rich & smooth with a fantastic strawberry taste! I added 2 drops of red gel paste food coloring as mentioned, and it made it a beautiful pink that was even more appealing to the eye. I cut the recipe back by 1/3 & it fit in my Cuisinart with room to spare, so I'll use the full amount next time, even if I have to pour a bit out. It's completely worth it for that extra bit of ice cream! Oh yes, I forgot to mention I added some chopped fresh strawberries close to the end of the cycle.
So easy and so delicious! I didn't add the vanilla because I wanted a strong strawberry flavor, and I forgot the salt. Everyone loved it! Will definitely make again.
made recipe as written, halved quantity and left out food coloring. it was delicious.
Don't add extra strawberries. It will make it icy.
Yummy and EASY. Used 4C 1/2 & 1/2 as I had some in fridge. Cut the sugar in 1/2 as I'm trying to cut back on sugar.

Super easy, was out of vanilla(smh) and used the caviar from 1/2 of a vanilla pod I had, because I had extra berries I added them as well which made it about 2 1/2 -3 cups. Positively wonderful, will never buy store bought again.
I made this using lactose free half and half for my son, 1 Teaspoon of vanilla, no salt. It turned out great. Will definitely make this again.
Delicious and so easy! I made this with the only strawberries I had - about 1 cup. It fit perfectly in my Kitchenaid ice cream attachment. Thank you for a great recipe!

Ice cream tastes really good. This recipe did call for more than my machine could handle, that explains the overflow and the ice cream to be icy instead of creamy. I use Cuisinart ice cream maker. However, that was only the second time I used the machine. The next time, I will definitely adjust the amount to fit my machine and also reduce the vanilla so it won't overpower the strawberry taste. Other than that, I love this recipe. Thank you!

I assist my 7 year old in making this ice cream we LOVED LOVED IT! !! So easy to make. We did tweak it a little only use one cup of whole milk and 1 teaspoon of vanilla due to other reviews. Thank you for the heads up.

This is a quick and delicious ice cream recipe! I can't do dairy so I use coconut milk instead of milk or cream and I use frozen strawberries that and thaw and mash in bag. Super quick and has a great strawberry flavor.

I reduced the servings to 6 (which still made 1.5 quarts) to fit in my Cuisinart Ice Cream Maker and used fresh blueberries and raspberries since that's what we had. Also used half & half instead of whole milk (at the suggestion of reviewer naples34102) , though next time I would just use milk & heavy cream since it is a bit heavy on the cream flavor (tastes more like "Berries & Cream" ice cream than berry ice cream). Pretty good for quick and easy, egg-less and heat-less ice cream (so far - haven't yet eaten the frozen stuff, just the fresh-out-of-the-machine stuff).

I also used my Blendtec blender to mix everything, which was a first for me. And I didn't bother with food coloring. The berries made it plenty pink without it!

My strawberries were too large and froze like ice cubes. I would half the recipe and make it in parts. As it freezes it over flowed the bowl. I am also considering making a simple syrup with the sugar and berries, cooking them slightly before adding them. This was my first attempt, so I think I need more practice.

My son Noah and I made this tonight. We used low fat milk instead of whole because that's what we had, and I only used one tsp of vanilla and didn't measure the salt, but used slightly less than the recipe called for. We didn't have food coloring, so we skipped that. It turned out PERFECT! This was our first time making ice cream, and we will definitely be using this recipe again. By the way, we used less salt and vanilla because it seemed like a lot, but after tasting the finished product, I feel like we could have used the amounts called for and it would have still been delish. Also, omit the strawberries, and this is a wonderful base to experiment with different flavors.
My husband requested Strawberry Ice Cream for his birthday. It is definitely a favorite of his. He said this recipe was excellent and do not lose it.

I cut in half the ingredients and added 3 tiny sweet spicy green peppers to the strawberry purée to spark a twist on the taste. Good recipe, very easy, I'll use it again! My ice team maker (kitchen aid ice cream attachment) is brand new and I am still testing it out.. this came out perfect, creamy and delicate.
I made no changes whatsoever. It was a breeze making this, and it made the most luxurious and delicious ice cream. Perfect recipe! Thanks for sharing!
I just made this - delicious! I used Light cream & skim milk to reduce the calories.
Great!

Great recipe! Simple yet delicious - i love it ... And I don't even like strawberry ice cream!
Used white vanilla extract (since that was all I had) and it gave a nice subtle hint of vanilla that doesn't over-power the strawberry flavour. Thanks for sharing!
A perfect base for eggless ice cream. I will definitely use this again when I need to whip up a dessert

Made this recipe without any changes using a KitchenAid ice cream attachment. My family loved it! I've made it several more times over the past few months omitting the food coloring and adding a few extra strawberries if I have them. Both recipes are great. It's now my "go-to" recipe for ice cream. Thanks for sharing!

This was delicious- reminded me of my grandpas homemade ice cream. The only change I would make next time is to puree the majority of the strawberries as just mashing them left large chunks of strawberries that look very pretty but feel like eating big chunks of ice and kind of hurts your teeth. Next time I will follow reviewer Naples34102 recommendation of pureeing 1 1/2 c strawberries and mashing 1/2 c. Otherwise it was awesome and I'll absolutely make it again!

Excellent!!! Made with 2 cups sliced fresh strawberries which had been sugared the night before. Used 3/4 cup sugar and 1 t. vanilla which was way too much vanilla taste so had to add 1 1/2 t. strawberry extract. Also made with 3 large bananas and 1/2 t. vanilla. Still too much vanilla as I had to add 1/2 t. banana extract. 3/4 cup sugar was too much for the banana ice cream so added mini chocolate chips.
Very easy and turns our light and creamy. I had flash frozen strawberries in the freezer from last year and they worked very well. I did use the food coloring to give it the perfect rosy color.
I don't usually write reviews but... I made this recipe in my ice cream maker - no changes. Delicious and easy. We all loved it. Actually, so did the dogs :-)

Great recipe only I did not use food coloring and instead of whole milk used half & half for one cup and 1% for other half. Also should add strawberries close to end of cycle to keep them from getting all wrapped around dasher. Used kitchen aid mixer attachment and this was a wonderful and easy recipe
